x264.Description: Scanner disabled: the scanner is disabled and cannot be used.
x264.Action: Enter the configuration menu, and re-enable the scanner module. See“840.xx service check” on page 2-44.

x264.Description: This message is posted when the MFP PORs. Enter the configuration menu, and re-enable the scanner module. See“840.xx service check” on page 2-44.
Image pipeline ASIC
x264.Action: See“CCD service check” on page 2-46. Also, see“Flatbed home position service check” on page 2-47.

x264.Description: Service image processing unit: AFE register mismatch
Service image processing unit: SCNCHN DMA
Service image processing unit: new line too soon interrupt
x264.Action: Check the sequencer settings. See“CCD service check” on page 2-46. Also, see“Flatbed home position service check” onpage 2-47.

x264.Description: Service image processing unit: tonal data overrun
x264.Action: See“CCD service check” on page 2-46. Also, see“Flatbed home position service check” on page 2-47.

x264.Description: Service image processing unit: image processing too slow
System time out: SIZAR out of band interrupt
Service image processing unit: output data uncollected
Service image processing unit: SCNCHN DMA underrun
Service image processing unit interrupt handler delayed crash
Scanner failure: communication failure
x264.Action: See“CCD service check” on page 2-46.

x264.Description: Scanner failure: carriage failed to home or move todesired position
x264.Action: Carriage mechanical failure. See“Flatbed motor service check” on page 2-46.

x264.Description: Scanner Failure: ADF mechanical failure
x264.Action: See“ADF paper jam service check” on page 2-49.

x264.Description: Scanner Failure: general mechanical failure detected
x264.Action: See“CCD service check” on page 2-46.

x264.Description: Scanner Failure: pick roller engage failure
Scanner Failure: pick roller disengage failure
Scanner failure: lamp failure
Front scan module output level error
Front scan module lamp level too low: front Mono channel, Front Color channels, Front Red channel, Front Green channel, and/or Front Blue channel is detected tohave low lamp level.
Rear scan module lamp level too low: Rear Mono channel, Rear Color channels, Rear Red channel, Rear Green channel, and/or Rear Blue channel is detected tohave low lamp level.
CCD failure
Front scan module cable failure or SCC card failure
x264.Action: Check each channel (mono, R, G, B) for identical values indicating bad cable and/or SCC card. Excessive noise test for the dark data indicating some sort of CCD or analog electronics issue on that channel or channels. See“CCD service check” on page 2-46.

x264.Description: Rear scan module cable failure or SCC card failure
Cable/SCC failure: front scan module connector or cablefailure.
x264.Action: See“CCD service check” on page 2-46.

x264.Description: Cable/SCC failure: rear scan module connector or cablefailure
Front calibration strip unusable
Rear calibration strip unusable
Front calibration strip too far left
Front calibration strip too far right
Front calibration strip has excessive skew
Front calibration strip has excessive bow
Front calibration strip has excessive dark area: front excessive variability for Mono, Red, Green, or Blue.
Front magnification exceeds limits: rear excessive variability for Mono, Red, Green, or Blue.
Modem failure: the Configuration ID bit that describesthe device’s modem doesn’t match the actual modem installed in the device.
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: Fax storage: the amount of flash storage available on the device is too small. Note: The NAND Flash partitioncan shrink as bit failures cause blocks to be invalidated.
Fax storage: the device’s flash partition is invalid or unavailable.
Modem/Config ID mismatch: a device has a modem installed, but its Configuration ID indicates that a modem shouldn’t be present.
HD/Config ID mismatch: a device has a hard drive installed, but its Configuration ID indicates that a hard drive shouldn’t be present.
Engine software error
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: Paperport link driver error
Interface violation by RIP
Interface violation by paperport device
RIP interface drive error
DC pick motor stall
DC pick motor excessive PWM
DC pick motor below speed
DC pick motor over speed
DC pick motor error
Lost encoder feedback
Transfer service error
x264.Action: Replace the transfer roll. See“Transfer roll service check” on page 2-43.

x264.Description: Under temperature during steady state control.
x264.Action: Replace the fuser. See“Fuser service check” on page 2-29.

x264.Description: Under temperature during standby control.
Fuser failed to ramp to target temperature
Fuser is over temperature.
Open thermistor check.
Wrong fuser installed. The fuser type stored in the cartridge ID does not match the actual fuser installed inthe printer.
Service fan error
x264.Action: Replace the fan. See“Cooling fan service check” on page 2-27.

x264.Description: Toner sensor error
x264.Action: Remove the toner cartridge, and shake it Try a different toner cartridge, if possible. If the error persists, then replace the toner level sensor. See“Toner level sensor removal” on page 4-75.

x264.Description: No home window
No sensor transition (closed)
No sensor transition (open)
Wrong printhead installed
x264.Action: Replace the printhead. See“Printhead service check” on page 2-43.

x264.Description: No first hsync
Lost hsyncs
Mirror motor locked: No hsync received
Motor unable to reach operating speed
Transport motor initial lock failure
x264.Action: Replace the main motor gear drive. See“Main motor service check” on page 2-30.

x264.Description: Main transport motor lost lock
LVPS service error
x264.Action: Replace the LVPS/HVPS. See“LVPS/HVPS service check” on page 2-29.

x264.Error: Controller board and operator panel service errors

x264.Description: Failed engine board
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: Mismatch between EEPROM and mirror memoryNote:A new controller board or operator panel has been installed, and has not been properly prepared for thisuse. Install a new note. Do not install both the controller board and the operator panel at the same time without a POR in between.
x264.Action: Install a new controller bored or operator panel. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26or“Operator panel service check” on page 2-31.

x264.Description: Error with secure NVRAM on the controller board
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: A recoverable MVRAM Cyclic Redundancy Check error occurred.
x264.Action: Performing POR will clear this error.

x264.Description: NVRAM chip failure with mirror
x264.Action: Replace the operator panel. See“Operator panel service check” on page 2-31.

x264.Description: NVRAM chip failure with system part.
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: The code ROM or NAND flash failed the Cyclic Redundancy Check or the NAND experienced an uncorrectible multi-bit failure.
RIP card failure: processor failure
Processor overtemp
RIP card failure: ASIC failure
Printer has performed more than 100 “shift and reflash” operations as a result of ECC bit corrections
Controller verification failure of boot code
x264.Action: Call the next level of support to update the firmware, or replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: Failure to authenticate Signature Verification Code
Signature Verification Code failed to authenticate a code partition.
x264.Action: Update firmware and call the next level ofsupport, or replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: Jump to unverified address
Unknown boot failure
Chipset hardware failure
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: Chipset did not respond to command request.
Challenge secret failure
Self test failed during initialization.
EEPROM retention error
Insufficient device space during HW prog
Incremental counter reset exceeds maximum value
Increment count failed due to max value limit
Invalid SP memory configuration
RAM memory error: RAM soldered on the controllerboard is bad
x264.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller board service check” on page 2-26.

x264.Description: RAM memory error: memory card in slot is bad.
x264.Action: Replace the memory card.

x264.Description: Download Emulation Cyclic Redundancy Check Error:checksum failure detected in the emulation header or emulation file.
x264.Action: Disable the Download Emulation. Program the download emulation into the firmware card again. If this does not resolve the problem, then replace the firmware card and download the emulation again.

x264.Description: Unrecognizable network
x264.Action: Call the next level of support.

x264.Description: Unrecoverable software error in network port
Bad checksum while programming network port
x264.Action: Call the next level of support.

x264.Description: Flash parts failed while programing network port
Engine experiencing unreliable communication with the specified device
x264.Action: Call the next level of support.

x264.Description: Engine protocol violation detected by the specifieddevice
Communications error detected by the specified device
Invalid command received by the specified device
Invalid command parameter received by the specifieddevice
An equipment check condition has occurred in the specified device, but the device is unable to identify the exact component failure.
The specified device has detected an equipment check in its system card.
